concept.title: Shift or Personnel Changes

audience.otherprops: shift supervisors, maintenance personnel, operations managers, safety and compliance officers, machine operators

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Defines how lockout tagout responsibilities transfer during shift changes and personnel handovers to maintain isolation integrity.

othermeta.name: taxonomy
othermeta.content: domain:ehs/usecase:manage-shift-and-personnel-changes/industry:glass manufacturing heavy machinery and industrial equipment

othermeta.name: tags
othermeta.content: shift handover, isolation continuity, shift logs

ol.li:
If an authorized employee working on a machine or equipment leaves the job before it is completed, such as job re-assignment or shift change, the next employee shall install a personal lock and tag to the machine’s energy isolation device before the first employee removes his/her original lock and tag.
If not possible, the first employee must remove his/her lock and tag, allowing the next employee to immediately place his/her lock and tag on the machine’s energy isolation device.

Where there is no overlap of workers, but lockout must be maintained, the affected department supervisor’s lock and tag shall be applied before the person leaving the job assignment or piece of equipment removes their lock and tag.
